metadata.title: CVE-2022-34481 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the nsTArray_Impl::ReplaceElementsAt() function, an integeroverflow could have occurred when the number of elements to replace was toolarge for the container. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102, FirefoxESR < 91.11, Thunderbird < 102, and Thunderbird < 91.11. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34481` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.11.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
